Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Nadra_12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a area where the romans lives, but close enough to the attractions. A few stop with the tram, and piazza Popolo is just some footsteps away. The hotel staff were helpful and we enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Response: ''Hidden fees''”
Reviews.Author: laraos
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last summer and there are no ''hidden fees''. The extra 26 euros which that person mentioned would have been city tax, which (as they explain when you pay it) you have to pay wherever you stay in Rome and it's only about 6 euros per night. They charge quite a lot for internet, but they never hide that form you there are signs which tell you that everywhere and you only get the internet if you ask for it. We never needed internet anyway. Please don't be put off by that review, I know I would be if I hadn't stayed there before. It's a really lovely hotel and staff are all charming with great English and we never felt like information was withheld.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden fees in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: HuiSeacat
Reviews.Content: The hotel Villa Glori in Rome has hidden fees a top the booked fee, that was 26 Euros per each room plus 6 Euros internet fee for each day. That was really bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: carolemh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a three night trip to Rome. The hotel is a a four stop tram ride away from the city centre and we loved this aspect as it meant we got so see the "real" part of the city apart from all the other tourists. The hotels reception staff are VERY HELPFUL and went out of their way to help us in planning our days out. Breakfast is good and have good variety to full up on before heading out to explore Rome. Would love to go back to this wonderful city and would stay here time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean, affordable comfort”
Reviews.Author: Dansza
Reviews.Content: We are glad we met Alessio who is such a great help, as all the rest of staff. They made us feel at home. The tram wasn't working when we were there which proved a problem at night. I miss Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travler004
Reviews.Content: This hotel was out of the way.Far from the city center but short walking distance to the tram.Hotel was very clean with nice spacious bathroom although the rooms were much smaller.It was very quiet during the night .Breakfast buffet was good with lots of varied choices.The night time receptionist named Alessio was very helpful.He made extra effort in helping us with our reservations for our shuttle to Civitavecchia where the day receptionist didn't want to be bothered helping us.Very stern and methodical,won't deviate from her script.Overall it was a good place for the price.We will stay here again if we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: KLBOS
Reviews.Content: Booked this 4 star hotel after much research , it is in a quiet location but offers easy access to the main sites on the No 2 tram which stops at Piazza De Popolo- the hotel offers a welcome retreat from the crowds of central Rome - we like to walk so did walk to the Vatican and the Colosseum from here but the tram is quicker! the staff were very friendly Katarina on reception offered retaurant recommendations and Pasquale was a great help and good fun! Local restaurants offered excellent food at a non tourist price and were buzzing with locals which added to the charm- a great nights sleep every night as there was no noise! Rooms were spotless and offered all that ws needed - a cute bar and breakfast room - this may not be central Rome but don't be put off we had an amazing visit and loved every second!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe Y
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights toward the end of August. The hotel was very clean, the staff was very nice and the room was large by European standards. The bathroom was spacious and the breakfast in the morning was very filling and tasty. The hotel is about 100 meters from the Tram stop, so it was very easy to get into Rome. We will stay here again the next time we come to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Glori, Rome”
Reviews.Author: EssexAmber
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel for a short trip to Rome. Although this is not in central Rome, it only took less than 10 mins to get there on the Metro. The Hotel is a good walk from Metro Flaminio, but there is tram right outside the station that takes you almost to the door, only takes a few minutes. Very clean, good room, although a bit small but you are only there to sleep in it. Breakfast adequate. Air conditioning a godsend, and rooms cleaned daily, with fresh towels etc... If touring, get a ROMA PASS as this is invaluable, you can use it on buses, trams and Metro, and also gets you into 2 musuems/sites free. the pas lasts 3 days and only costs 25 Euros. Nice restuarants opposite the Metro, Plazza del Popolo (go though the massive arch), nice to sit outside and enjoy the Italian way of life, even if it is just for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and not too far from everything”
Reviews.Author: 7auri7ocks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend for 5 days, the hotel is gorgeous but the rooms are small and the breakfast is limited but it was perfect for our budget sightseeing trip as its close enough to the centre without costing a fortune

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay, but wrong promises and bad excuses”
Reviews.Author: greenjapan
Reviews.Content: I was in the Hotel during Pentecost. It is a nice hotel in a quiet area, north of the center. On the webpage they claimed to have a balcony, for us the reason to book this hotel. I even wrote a mail and they promised me one. then however i didn't get one, they were really badly organised and had clearly lied: there are only two rooms with balcony and apparently even though i reserved this i didn't get it. My complaint was unheard and I felt really badly treated after that. The only thing they said is "next time you come, you can have a balcony!" But why should I trust their promises if they didn't deliver the first time? The room was very small, touching the wall from the bed to all sides possible/unavoidable.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience in an hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: edtani
Reviews.Content: I have a great respect for the Italian people.However, I can not understand how is possible to give 4 star qualification to this place. We travel to Rome for participating in a medical meeting. I received a super small room, with a small window, The room was for disabled persons, The bathroom had a shower without any cover, that means that after taking a shower, it was impossible to enter without waking into the water.Why they sell this room to people without special needs?? I saw the double room of one of my colleagues, It was smaller than my room without possibilities to move into the room and only 50 cm within the bed and wall. I understand that other reviewers were satisfied, and they got better rooms than us. my recommendation is avoid this place, you have good chance to pay for a 4 star hotel and get a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice neighbourhood, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mabi
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet, authentic neighbourhood far away from the tourist trail but only 5 minutes by tram to Piazza del Popolo, this hotel is set back from a quiet street which meant we could sleep with the window open. There are a few small restaurants within a minute's walk from the hotel which are excellent value for money - packed with locals. Small but clean and bright sunny room and bathrooms. Breakfast buffet could be better - plastic juice and no fruit. Overall, we were very happy with what we got. The only issue I can see is noise. If you are staying in one of the rooms on the ground floor you will have noise from the jam-packed breakfast room from 7 to 10. Even on our floor noise was an issue - cleaners started at 7 and made a lot of noise. Would come again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: laraos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Glori for a week, booked a month in advance through hotels.com. Got a great rate, lovely hotel, really clean room and bathroom. Staff were very attentive and helpful with how to get to places. Despite that it may look a bit difficult to get to, it's really, really easy- 6 minutes on the tram from Piazza Del Popolo. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy, a pain to get to, over priced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: HealthAngel
Reviews.Content: I spent hours and hours searching through reviews to choose a hotel for our first trip to Rome. My boyfriend and I visited the city to celebrate my 30th birthday and unforturnately, despite the research, the hotel really let us down. The main issues - really noisy room, including cleaners vaccuming and cleaning the rooms (while loudly banging the doors frequently as they go in and out) at midnight! A pain to get to, and overpriced for what you get. Plus staff who are really unhelpful for tourist info and ideas. And really slow, rubbish internet 6 euros an hour. One of the best things about going on holiday is not having to get up early. So if you do plan to stay here (although I would strongly recommend finding somewhere else), when you arrive, if they offer you room 20 or 30, ask for another room. Unless you plan to get up before 7am every day. As this room was the noisiest I have ever stayed in. What we weren't told when we arrived is that the room is right next door to the breakfast room, so you will be woken every morning by the horrendous screeching and scraping of chairs on the floor from 7 till 10. You can feel the vibrations in the bed it's that close! They also decided to clean the room next door one night at midnight, including vacuuming and going in and out frequently letting the door slam, while talking loudly right outside our bedroom door, with no regard for us. Awful, awful behaviour. The location is rubbish. Unless you like very long walks, you will need to get the metro to Flaminio then a tram for three stops to Ankara. It's just a pain, as there are thousands of hotels in the centre itself, it's really annoying to be that far out. I also found the staff unhelpful when it came to tourist info. We wanted some ideas for something amazing to do on my actual birthday. But the only things the staff could suggest were a night tour of the city, and an opera (which wasn't even on during our stay!) I know they must get commission for these two activities, but that is very poor. I refuse to believe there are no other options! The night tour is 70 euros per person, completely overpriced. It includes a meal, but we ate in a lovely restaurant called Biga right next to the Colosseum, with main meals, wine and side dishes for two, for a total of 30euros. The tour doesn't even take you in to the sites, so it is basically a very costly bus/taxi round. We would not stay here again and would recommend finding somewhere nearer the centre. It isn't cheap to stay and watch out for the visitor tax, as we found we had an extra bill at the end of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaness and kindness”
Reviews.Author: kristen012
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Rome, it was unforgettable. I was given personal assistans and comfort. The next time i have to go to Rome I'll be back to Villa Glori

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ralica_11
Reviews.Content: Usually I don't care about the hotel's room, but it was very cleaned. Plenty of choise for breakfast and the hotel is at 10 min walking from the city center. I've bought ticket for open bus hop on hop off and ticket for Vatican's museum and the Sixtine chappel. There is a good pizza just acrossing the street.

Reviews.Title: “more than expexted”
Reviews.Author: SONIA066Moskow
Reviews.Content: It was very good hotel, 5 min. from the city center by tram. Very clean room,breakfast was better than I expected concedering that italian people have just coffe for breakfast, there were pastries, coffe, cappuccino, espresso,cake, salami, eggs and more. The staff also was grate, we have bought a tour to Florence and we have appreciated their assistans for every each kind of information we needed. Thenk you Hotel villa Glori!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel - with one caveat”
Reviews.Author: zurichcouple
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews are clear about this hotel. The overall impression is very positive. The close proximity to (good and frequent) public transportation, the friendliness of the staff (particularly Nicholas at the reception desk), and the rooms that are adequate and very clean, leave nothing to be desired. The one caveat is that several times during our stay we happened to witness that reservations hadn't been forwarded or were non-existent; for ours, too, they had to make several phone calls to Spain to realize that we had indeed payed for the entire stay. While we got our room after that hick-up, there seems to have been at least one incident that people were told otherwise. It seems advisable to phone or e-mail the hotel ahead of the arrival in order to make sure that the reservation is indeed in their system and will be honored. With that one caveat said, we will indeed stay there again, should we decide to travel to Rome another time.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINATELY NOT RECOMENDED,SERIOUSLY!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra033
Reviews.Content: I had booked three nights at this hotel and upon arrival I was told that it is overbooked and I will have to spend one night in their sister hotel. The question is-how can it be overbooked when at the time of reservation it was confirmed as available?! After reading other reviews it seems common problem in this hotel and the managment of hotel should sort it out once and forever! Very poor organisation! They wasted about 2 hours in total of my precious time with all transfers to and back again. Next,when checking in,receptionist took copy of my passport (!) instead of filling a form. Who knows what can happen with it if gets in wrong hands? At he end it turned out,he had mixed my country of origin up in the file in computer,which was more than irritating! There was absolutely nothing exciting about this place-small room,horrible breakfast with terrible,kinda old tasting coffee and not fresh cheese and ham. Location is bad too,nearest metro station is good walk away,bus stop is only some 15 m away but it takes about half an hour to reach city centre.And I almost forgot, you will be asked to leave the key,whenever you go out,what will cause additional inconvenience! I CERTAINLY WON'T BE BACK AT THIS HOTEL AND I WILL TELL TO ALL MY FRIENDS TO DO THE SAME!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers4
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room, so one double bed and one single. The room was a bit small. but fine for our family of 4. It did have good storage for our suitcases. We had a lovely air conditioned room on the main level, no view, but I didn't need the room for that - just sleep and shower. It was nice and clean, the beds were a bit on the hard side, but good enough. The hotel staff was VERY helpful - they gave us maps, help with trams, trains and directions to a pool when we were all touristed out. The breakfast is adequate, ask for espresso or cappucino - they have it, you just have to ask the server. We walked to the main shopping area, Piazza de Popolo with the kids - it's really not that far. We did take one of the double decker buses to some sites, touristy yes, but they really are a decent deal. DO NOT MISS the Vatican City when you are there. Just please be respectful and quiet - I couldn't believe how rude the tourists are in there! The Sistine Chapel was dissapointing - I hate to be rude, but I've seen better. And the tourists were the worst there. Don't miss the cupola - worth the 7Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful. Rooms are bit”
Reviews.Author: BBrogers
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful but rooms are basic. After a 4 am start our room not ready at check in time of 1 pm. Bit out of the way from sites but overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: jklivintraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Villa Glori during mid-December, and I can say that I have been really satisfied with my stay there. I traveled on my own, so I booked a single room. Personally I'm the type of traveller that I want my hotel to be just a place to sleep well after a tiring day visiting all the sights around (each) city. I'm here to tell you that Villa Glori is ready to offer you much more than this. First of all, as I have already told, I ordered a single room, and that's i got of course. But, it was a single room with a double bed. I don't know if this is common experience for others, but I saw this happening for the first time. It's great to see after all that there are still people who care about their customers and give them special treatment. Furthermore, the hotel stuff except for being professional, proved to be amazingly polite. It was the most polite stuff I've ever met at a hotel. They will surely steal your heart with their behaviour. My room, room 50, was very clean, roomy, really functional, and had everything I needed to feel comfortable and honestly, almost like home.Nice design, modern furniture, everything great. The only average thing in the room was the TV, although you may watch a variety of channels, coming from many different countries, including CNN, BBC, Eurosport, etc. After all these, there is no need to refer to the sleep quality-It's expected to say that I was really satisfied. Quiet hotel, great matress-pilow combination. Better than what I have at home-and that's what you expect when you stay at a hotel. The hotel's value is exactly what you expect from a 4 star hotel. Nothing more, nothing less. The only thing that was not as good as I expected, was the location of the hotel. Well, I have to say that I'm very demanding in this matter-I want a metro station just outside of the hotel's door, if possible. The location is not bad, but it's not amazing either. The hotel is located near a tram station, which averagaly passes by every 5-7 minutes, and takes you via "Via Flaminia" to the "Flaminio" metro station within 6 minutes-and from there, by train, you go wherever you go. If you decide not to wait for the train and to walk all the way to the Flaminio metro station, you'll need about 20-25 minutes. It has to be noted that at this station is located also the quite famous "Piazza del Popolo". In addition, the hotel is close to the "Maxxi" museum (sth like London's "Tate modern") and 15 minutes on foot from the Olympico stadium. How to get there from Fiumicino airport: It's really easy in fact. First of all, you need to reach the Termini station (city centre) and that's not hard no matter which your terminal is. You may go there by train (Fiumicino-Termini with 15 euros) which takes way every half an hour. Some airlines also support shuttle buses to Termini(8 euros).A local taxi to Termini will cost you 35-40 euros. When you reach Termini, you'll have to walk a little if you go there by train, and then you follow the red metro line to Batistini. 4 stations away is "Flaminio", and from there you catch the tram, just outside the metro station, and then you will need to get advised from a map to find the excact location of the hotel. It is very easy, though. P.S: Do not look after "Via Bernando Calentano". There's nothing like this-or at least I didn't find it. You will easily see the hotel's label on the right side of the "Via Vignola" (with direction from the tram and to the Olympico stadium). Believe me, it's very easy to find the hotel even without map.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic...just not Catarinah!!”
Reviews.Author: london129
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this wonderful hotel for 5 nights recently. It was perfectly located, very close to the number 2 tram to Flaminia..and then a metro away from all of the wonderful sites in Rome. Nicolas and the other gentlemen working at the hotel were absolutely fantastic. Very very helpful. BEWARE of Catarinah! She was always so moody and extremely unhelpful.. She obviously needs further training!! Other than her, the rooms were very clean, the whitest bedsheets ever! The breakfast was also very good, alot of selection too. As previously mentioned, this hotel is conveniently located AND not far from the wonderful sites. I suggest you purchase a day travel card at the newspaper shop to the right of the hotel. For only 4 euros, you can travel the tram, metro and buses all day long, much better than getting a taxi! There are also so many places to eat close to the hotel, i would definately stay in this hotel again, I had such a wonderful experience, this is five star!! London 129

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Jan220166
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this fantastic hotel recently and highly recommend it. I was worried that as it was about a fifteen minute walk away from the city centre we might not like it,how wrong could I be! The number 2 tram stop is just outside the hotel and this takes you to Piazza del Popolo,from where many of Romes main attractions can be easily reached. The hotel itself is spotless and the staff are all very helpful. Because the hotel is situated on a quiet side street we sometimes found it hard to believe that we were in a busy city(this was very welcome after a long days sightseeing!) If we are lucky enough to ever return to Rome,we will certainly book Villa Glori again. Jan Prestly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, clean, convenient rooms”
Reviews.Author: shy2406
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely! To get to it, get the metro line A to Flaminia. Once you exit the station, follow the road for 100yrds until you see a tram stop. It has two lines, but only one ever seems to be used. If you get on the tram, I think it is around 4 stops in or can be described as the stop after the tram has changed roads (right turning) and gone past 1 petrol station (right hand side) and the stop is just by an esso petrol station (left) The hotel is on the street opposite and is a two minute walk from the tram drop off. The hotel is lovely and clean. After reading some reviews about how small the rooms were, I did get a little nervous, but we didn't find them to be too small. they weren't the largest, but we had a travel cot and pushchair up in there most of the time and we weren't falling over anything. (oh and travel cot hire charged at E10 / night) Room temperature was perfect for us, but not as cold as many people seem to think it should be, but it was perfect for us and we slept really well. Beds are very comfy and rooms quiet Staff are polite and helpful, you only need to ask! There are some maps of Rome in the reception area, which are really useful for seeing the sites. We didn't use the wi-fi which was E6 for 24hours in your room and E6 for 1 hour in reception. Breakfast was standard continental fare, with plenty on it including scrambled eggs, ham, cheese, salami, bread, pastrys, cake, cereal, yogurt. Coffee isn't great, but as mentioned before, just ask for a cappucino as everyone else and that is much better. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room, which is a shame. Rooms kept clean, but had to ask for toilet paper to be replenished as that wasn't done in the mornings (I did have a stinky cold) I would most certainly recommend this hotel due to ease to get to and from it, it's reasonable rates and comfortable rooms. I would recommend paying E16 to get a week long transport ticket for Rome (metro, tram and bus) as it was really useful getting to places further afield. Book Vatican tickets in advance, as the queue was around 3 hours long by 11am (we did book in advance) Just be warned there are lots of steps in Rome and on the metro, something we didn't take into consideration when bringing a pushchair and toddler! We managed fine, but there are plenty of easier places to go. She did enjoy herself a great deal though!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, cosy, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: BengtNorway
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in this hotel late august / early september 2010, travelling with three children (one of the children stayed in another room with his grandmother). I am not easilly impressed when it comes to hotels, but this little gem won me and the whole family over. We had a double room, probably the largest room type they have, and it was clean, spacious, cosy, in excellent condition, nice bath with hot tub,and everything just worked perfectly. The staff was friendly and helpful and spoke decent English. The hotel is situated on a quiet street a couple of kilometers north of Piazza del Popolo in a very nice neighborhood. The first of september all of the local shops and restaurants suddenly opened after the holidays, and you can find everything you need in the immediate surroundings, with delicatessies, coffe bars, Gelaterias, pharmacy, etc. You won't find many tourists in the neighborhood (luckily), but you still had to be out early (the restaurants open at 7:30 pm) in order to get a decent table in the restaurants (just across the street), the Romans go out to eat! Very nice food and atmosphere. We took the trolley to Piazza del Popolo every day, works perfect, cost 1 euro, and just a two minute walk from the hotel. If we ever go back to Rome, this is definetely the hotel we will stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect AC”
Reviews.Author: Sedona44
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in this "dorm" room that passes as a 4 star hotel, the first night after talking to 2 different desk people they finally decided to flip the switch at the front desk at 11 pm, and the ac would only run if the switch was in the right position, the second day we had no ac at all, I watched the bell man play the switch for an hour, before announcing no ac till tomorrow which the front desk claimed as well, we were welcome to leave the window open with all the lovely inter city noise. At 7:30am the next morning with little sleep the ac "magically" came on. Don't believe this hotel's claim of ac in the room

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: BogtrotterBelfast
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at this hotel. Handy location not to far from main sights and fairly easy to find. Hotel was in good condition with lovely rooms although single for daughter was single room and small. Staff were friendly and helpful although we did have a 15 min wait to be served at the bar whilst staff dealt with a very difficult customer. Dining room used for breakfast is rather cosy and would benefit from more space.

Reviews.Title: “I would probably not return”
Reviews.Author: ChristianB
Reviews.Content: The Villa Glori hotel is reasonably priced for Rome but my main reason for chosing this hotel was its proximity to the tennis tournament at Foro Italico, The neighborhood is very sleepy and quiet and lacks bars, restaurant and shops. I would not stay here if I was in Rome to do sightseeing. The room was very small but clean and bathroom modern. However, the desk was too small, there was only one power outlet, the bed was rock hard and the AC did not work. Right outside my window was some kind of noisy ventliator so sleeping with the window open wasnt great. The wifi is only 6 euros but the weak signal did not reach my room. Breakfast is included and is above Italian average (the Italians lack any form of breakfast culture anyway). On the day of departure, I booked a car service to the airport through the reception. When I returned to the hotel at the agreed time, I was told the driver was late because of a football game. Now, no driver in Rome would not know about this match and its consequences on traffic so I was a bit upset. After waiting 20 min in vain, the receptionist then pointed out a taxi stand on a map and I made my way there. Unfortunately, she had not marked the taxi stand correctly on the map so it took me an extra 10 min to find it. I made my flight with a 2-3 minute margin after my new driver had pulled some spectacular stunts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value / pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: STGVirginia
Reviews.Content: We were two couples staying one night before moving on to Firenze. Clean rooms and very helpful and pleasant staff. It's true that the rooms are typically smaller than in the states but I have stayed in much smaller rooms and paid way more in New York City. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but could be great with just a little more.”
Reviews.Author: Medic1970
Reviews.Content: Booked through strength of recommendations on Trip Advisor. Easy enough to find - get to Termini from the airport, then to Flaminio on the Metro A line , across the road from the arch into Piazza Popolo get the number U2 bus for about 4 stops . Being close to Flaminio on the A line is good for travelling to the Vatican, less so for central tourist area ie Colloseum. Staff were friendly, good english spoken. Room - double bed ( well two pushed together securely ) took up most of the space in the room. ( see pics) Pretty clean. Shower only - not an issue for us. No tea or coffee making facilities - a big let down. I consider this pretty standard for good hotels. Satellite TV - only Italian channels on the Sky box - BBC World news in english on the ? Freeview but really terrible picture. Told the Sky isnt working properly - but I dont see how some stations would work and others not. I suspect paying the bit extra for english channels isnt worth it for them. Clientele - a 50/50 mix of tourists and cheap business travellers. Breakfast - ok you have 2 juices, tea, coffee, 3 types of cereal, sweet and normal croissants, bread rolls, yogurt, cheese slices, salami and ham slices. Some pastries. Would be fine if everything ( bar the croissants and pastries ) wasnt so absolutely tasteless. Good for a carbohydrate load before walking - but dont expect to walk away feeling satisfied. Cost - £146 for three nights. Overall not bad but not great either , food that tasted of something at breakfast plus kettle etc in room would have pushed it to 4 or even 5 from me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a quiet, leafy street”
Reviews.Author: MaggieJ
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel on a quiet and leafy little street. Happy I read through so many reviews and selected this one. Tiled room, nicely furnished and as other reviewers have said, spotless. Not exactly cheap or in the centre, but it seemed good value and definitely good quality for Rome especially after reading reviews for more central hotels. Got a taxi to and from the hotel to the station as it was a hot day - it was well worth it. The room was away from the other rooms, half underground and past the lift at the back of the hotel. Initially seemed very dark with view of concrete, but then again it was also very quiet, cool, and comfortable. Got a room with a shower, not a bath, but still it was a good size and again very clean with plenty hot water. Breakfast was also quite good and kept well stocked. Coffee really does taste odd as mentioned by other reviewers (the Italians left the coffee and requested espressos). Wireless was available at €6 for 24 hours. Reception were friendly and helpful. Although on the first night they recommended a nearby Restaurant - Ristorante Flaminia or similar. it was the most expensive and worst meal we had in Rome. It was also almost empty - yet the Vignola over the road was very busy and probably a better bet if you want to eat locally. Location is a little out of the centre, but only a short tram ride followed by a few minutes walk, so close enough to get back to after a days sightseeing before heading out again for a meal. The tram is just round the corner (This line also goes to the Vatican) and if the line hadn't been in the middle of some upgrades it would have taken us further into the centre. Once in the centre it is worth looking out for the little electric mini-buses 116, 117 and 119 which connect some of the main sites - see the route for electric powered vehicles: http://www.atac.roma.it/index.asp?p=2.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Charming Hotel with Excellent Service, but Location Could be Better”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesShopgirl
Reviews.Content: Good: Excellent service. The hotel staff speaks very good English and was very helpful. The room was small, nice and clean. You should not expect big rooms in Rome anyway. The breaskfast has good selections. The hotel offers shuttle service to the airport, for a very reasonable price, especially if you have a party of three or four. Worth it. Bad: We had to take a bus to get to the closet metro. At night, it sometimes takes a long time for the bus to come. It is not a long walk from hotel to Piazza de Popolo, which is the start of all tourist sites, but after a long day of walking, we just don't feel like waking back to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Dennis1939
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night stay in hotel villa glori rome. I normally book my trips with a travel agent but this time i booked the hotel with 1.800 hotels mainly because it was an Irish company.I was a bit concerned that when we arrive at the hotel there may be problems with the booking etc. as this was my first time to book this way but everything was perfect.Check in was easy,the hotel was lovely in every way.The hotel may appear to be good bit away from the centre of things but we walked everyday from the hotel to all the attractions even the colosseo.Public transport to the hotel is very easy.Tram No2 from Flaminio metro but take note at the moment they are upgrading the tram line so you have to walk a very short distance to get No 2 tram. You here all this talk about termni station and pickpockets dont be worried the people are lovely you just mind your wallet etc in a zipped pocket securely like anywhere else. Shop around,prices for everything vary in different locations but you can certainly get great value in rome. John and Mary Sligo Ireland

Reviews.Title: “a smashing hotel 20 minutes from popolo piazza.”
Reviews.Author: shollyoakes
Reviews.Content: a little gem, nice neighbourhood would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet neighborhood, perfect for mother/daughter budget travel”
Reviews.Author: starlitdazzle
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Villa Glori was just perfect for a quick trip in Rome as a mother/daughter team traveling together in Europe for the first time. The location may not have been extremely ideal but the price was great for the hotel seeing as how Rome can be VERY expensive. It was in a nice quiet neighborhood and offered a decent little breakfast in the lobby. They were also helpful in arranging for a cab to the airport for an early flight to the airport at the end of our stay. The room was small, but just perfect and the bathroom was great as well. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: asnakebite
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 3 nights here. Very nice, but small, rooms. Pleasant staff most of home speak some English. Breakfast was very good. Good restaurant just across the street for lunch or dinner. Short bus ride to the Flaminio train station.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tashy1019
Reviews.Content: This is a really really nice hotel. Upon checkin, the staff told us about attractions we might be interested in, gave us a map and directions to everything, just outstanding. We were 2 girls traveling together, and they gave us our own rooms across the hall from each other for no extra charge. I'm sure they just had more demand for the doubles for couples, but believe me, nothing preserves a female friendship more solidly than separate spaces, so we were thrilled. The single rooms we were put in where small but very nice. They included a safe which I did use, and the bathrooms were wonderful -- no leaking, very clean, very posh even. Using google maps to find this hotel (we took the metro to bus #2) misled me into thinking that the small alley this hotel is on went through to Via Flaminia. It does not. You will have to walk up Viale del Vignola and take a right. I would absolutely in a heart beat stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Over Booked?”
Reviews.Author: pilgrimgreenPlymouth
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Villa Glori Hotel on 20th Aug. 2009...to be informed that our room had no electricity, so they were sending us to the Hotel Grand Fleming at their expence. On arrival at the Hotel Grand Fleming the comment was"over booked again are they ?) Nice Hotel.. ideal. We had very enjoyable stay in Rome....We didn't get the chance to "sus" the Glori...so we can't give it a rating..but if you don't want to be let down..don't go there..

Reviews.Title: “Quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: rellegood
Reviews.Content: Small hotel but very nice. Rooms were smaller than I'm accustom to in the U.S., but were very nicely appointed. WiFi was available at 6 Euros per day. Short walk to catch the Tram to the Metro station. Approximately 15 minutes to most historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rob_S_K
Reviews.Content: Put simply, this is a very nice hotel. You soon realise that the city centre is easy to get to from the hotel, but, most importantly, while at the hotel there, it's very quiet. Trust me, once you've walked around Rome on a baking hot day, the last thing you need is a broken sleep through excessive noise (once made your own noises in your room, of course...). It's only a short walk to the first of Rome's historical attractions - Villa Borghese - and you soon find that every key attraction is close by. The staff were very friendly. The room was always immaculate (I noted, upon observing a room being cleaned across the corridor, how the wooden floor was washed eevry day). One of the other real attracttons of this hotel is the restaurant located just across the road - Ristorante Pizzeria Vignola. This is a genuine Italian restaurant - attended by Italian locals - and the food is exemplorary. We visited restaurants across the city and came back to this one twice more. They treated us so well and, typical of family-run establishments, you get a lot more than what you ordered (the glasses of wine somehow refilled themselves). Wherever you stay, visit this restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Small small small but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mokachu
Reviews.Content: This room was so small my knees hit the closet when I sit on the end of the bed. I was able to keep all my luggage (and I had alot) in the closet to keep the walk area clear though. I had to carry my large and heavy bags over a stair way to get to my room. The bathroom was decent sized and nice and clean. The bed was hard as a rock but I was able to sleep anyway. There are two wafer thin pillows so if you want to sit in bed you better have your own pillow. The neighborhood looked a little questionable, but after tooling around Rome for a couple of days I found it was average. The taxis will charge something different everytime you use them even from the same destintion. I didnt have enough time to figure out the public transportation. The front desk is very friendly and got us a good deal to the airport. Breakfast was a good selection of foods for all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Far enough from the center to be peaceful, but easy access to all the sights.”
Reviews.Author: CanelaSF
Reviews.Content: We booked through an internet consolidator and got a wonderful price (less than 100 euros/night) on this clean, comfortable hotel. It is outside the hustle of the center, but only 1/2 block from a tram that takes you directly to the Flaminio Metro station. Getting from the hotel to the sights of Rome was easy. There are several good restaurants in the neighborhood. It's primarily residential and safe to walk around in the evenings. Breakfast is Continental, but room service for breakfast is available with American-style breakfasts for an extra charge. The rooms are clean and comfortable but (like many places in Europe), very small. The shower in our room would be uncomfortable for a large or very overweight person. The reception desk is open 24 hours a day, with friendly and multilingual staff. We HIGHLY recommend the little neighborhood pizzeria/trattoria across the street (recommended by Villa Glori staff). It was friendly, welcoming, and provided the best meal we ate in all of Rome. Overall, a quiet and peaceful stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but with out the hassle and bussle”
Reviews.Author: wuciwug
Reviews.Content: A real gem of a hotel hidden just off the main road, very quaint, but exceptionally comfortable for the price. With in walking distance or Metro and Tram and even the spanish steps were ~20 minutes walk through a lovely part of Rome. Staying here really felt like you where in suburbia (not tourist ville) but without being anywhere unsafe or at all remote.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JandGCali
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Villa Glori for 4 nights in May. It was a fantastic experience. The rooms are beautiful and well maintained. It is in a great location. Just a tram ride away (5 minutes) to the nearest metro stop where you can reach anywhere in the city. I have stayed in other hotels in Rome that are closer to tourist attractions and I much prefered my time at Villa Glori. The front desk attendants are very charming and willing to help with any information they can. The restaurants surrounding the hotel are really good, but don't expect for anyone to speak English, you'll have to head to a tourist area for that. The breakfast is a little disappointing, but adequate. Next time I'm in Rome, I will head to this hotel without looking anywhere else. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “When out of Rome- do as the Romans!”
Reviews.Author: alreadybeen
Reviews.Content: I was informed at the last minute that I would be travelling to Rome for work. Keeping in mind that I had never left the North American Continent and that work decided NOT to spend top dollar on me I was unsure what to expect in Villa Glori. The website is a little misleading with lots of pictures of what seem to be large rooms. WRONG- they are mostly pictures of the common areas and the dining room- which are much smaller in real life. Now, this is not unusual for in Europe space is elusive and even if you have Donald Trump money you will still most likely have to suck in your gut when entering a room! Villa Glori is outside of the downtown, Vatican, tourist area. It is nicely settle in the middle of a Roman neighborhood. That means that it is high density all around The Hotel has something in the neighbor hood of two parking spaces so unless you want to fight the locals for a spot (and they have the edge in this battle) I would take a cab. The desk will gladly call a cab service for you and they are very friendly. The English is so-so, but since Rome is an international city it is possible to get aropund with any of the top 4 languages- even at Villa Glori. There is an elevator, though tiny (maybe two skinny adults fit) it is also extremely quiet. If you get a room by the elevator do not be concerned because you will not hear it. The hotel has less than 50 rooms and the desk will require that you leave the room key with them as you leave for the day. thats just fine because very room key has a large metal plate on it. The plate is used as an electrical key in your room. You slide it in a slot to get the power to turn on. Trust me- you will not want to put the key in your pocket. The rooms are typical European with twin beds unless you specifically book something else. The Tv's are flat panel HD but only CNN international is in English. That's should be fine because when in Rome...you shouldn't be watching too much TV! The decor is modern and the bathrooms are newly renovated complete with towel warmers! Seriously, the bathrooms are spacious, and the showers are comfy for all but the widest Americans. Breakfast is traditional Italian continental. Sliced meats, hard boiled eggs, and plenty of breads. The hotel does only breakfast as they do not have a full blown kitchen. Cereal, milk, sparkling water and fresh juice is also part of the free meal. Since the hotel is in the middle of a nice residential area there are a few restaurants within walking distance. During the day there is plenty of activity, but come evening it slows down to a trickle. Keep in mind that Italians eat pretty late so evening is longer than you might expect, but at night the streets are quiet. I would not walk around too late as the area, like most places in the world, has some scary dark alleys. If you decide to venture into the historical side of Rome (and why not) then the desk will call you a respectable cab and you are about ten kilometers away from Vatican City. I can not wait to visit Rome again. When I do I think Villa GLori will be one of the places I consider staying in. They were less expensive than the hotels outside of Vatican City. Two hundred dollars per night when I compared the rates to some of my business competition. The hotel is part is part of a small regional chain of hotels and they have quality standards and even nice smelling soap. There is a small bar and a public computer in the lobby, otherwise you can pay and use wifi in the room. You will see Rome much different by staying in a regular neighborhood than in the tourist area!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Roma!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RichiesWorldTour
Reviews.Content: I stopped at the Villa Glori for 4 Nights 24-28th Feb 2008, it was the best hotel i have stopped in for a few years. # Staff are very helpfull # Late Checkout # Very Clean # Very High Quality of room, ( I work for a electric company and they had our sockets and there are the most expensive you can buy!!) # Very Nice B'fast # Very Close (1 min walk) to the No 2 Tram this links the hotel to the airport and a tram and underground. # Fresh Bedsheets everyday # A very good selection of newspapers everyday. Our break would have been half as good if it wasnt for the hotel. This has to be the place to stop in Rome!!!! Well Done Villa Glori

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ComeVisitIreland
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It is an ideal place to base oneself in Rome. The neighbourhood is so quiet unlike many of the typical tourist hotels in the city centre. The rooms are spotless and have all modern facilities including Sky TV. The breakfast is excellent compared to what is often served on the continent. All the staff were excellent and most had an excellent command of english. Again I recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Villa Glori”
Reviews.Author: colesent
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 night trip to Rome staying at the Villa Glori. We were there to celebrate my Mothers 70th Birthday. We booked through Easyjet and Hotelopia having first checked reviews on Trip Advisor. What a brilliant hotel! Spotlessly clean - really outstanding! Loads of mirrors and chrome fitting all gleaming and shiney. Comfortable beds with crisp sheets that were changed after 2 nights. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful and because of the hotels location on a pedestrian side street so quiet for a city hotel. Access to the sites is via the no2 tram line around the corner on the main viale Flaminio. Never waited more than about 2 minutes. After 4 stops you can then link into the metro or just stroll across the Piazza del Popolo and onto the Via Del Corso for shops, Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The buffet breakfast was very pleasant, fresh bread and warm croissant, tea, coffee, ham, salami, cheese, yoghurts etc. The room was a bit stuffy (It was feb and the air con was not switched on although the facility was there. In warmer weather the room might not be so hot) and did not look out on anything but was nicely presented. The hotel does not have a restaurant or room service or that kind of thing but the rooms themselves, although not enormous, are definately of a 4 star standard. Air conditioned, flat screen TV, BBC world and CNN plus a movie viewing option that we didn't explore, mini bar (plenty of room for your own water/wine etc), safe (no charge), lovely soft towels and basic toiletries, laminate wooden floors (great for allergy sufferers I should think) all, as I have already mentioned, presented spotlessly. We reviewed many hotels in the budget to medium price bracket on Trip Advisor before making our selection, lots were around the Termini (Main railway station) area and many of the reviews talk of tired fittings, stained carpets and surley staff. Although the Termini is more central it is a busy, crowded and noisy area. The Quiet suberb where to Villa Glori is situated seemed to us to be the perfect place to unwind and recover after each days busy siteseeing schedual. We also found the local restaurants to be great. Friendly and unpretentious, packed out with local Roman patrons. Trentino's a couple of stops further out on the tram in the Piazza Mancini was a particular hit. Having typed the name of the restaurant I am not sure thats the right name. I will edit later if it isn't!

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet and private, authentic Rome neighborhood. . .”
Reviews.Author: adelaidetaylor
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Rome and we booked through a site that reserved plane, hotel, train tickets, and transfers for a 9-day tour of Rome, Florence, and Venice. This hotel was located near the tram that takes you directly to the Piazza Popolo, and from there you can get anywhere in Rome, either on foot or by subway. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was neat, clean and adequate in size. In the summer it would have been wonderful to use the large patio with table and chairs outside the French doors of our room. The bed was very hard, and the pillows very flat. The breakfast was fine, but no hot choices such as eggs, etc. We would have liked more places to eat in the immediate neighborhood for convenience. the two restaurants nearby were open/closed at their own convenience, and there were no markets open close by either. Overall we liked the hotel, but not sure if we would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joan&Peter
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Villa Glori before carrying on to Sorrento. It was a lovely hotel, although our room (211) was very small, not much room at all to hang up clothes. But it was very clean and the breakfast was adequate, just continental. It was a bit of a way out of the centre of Rome. We walked everywhere, but at the end of the day we just got on the No. 2 tram at Popolo/Flaminio for 3 or 4 stops. The hotel reception staff were very nice, except one girl who was a bit miserable, and not very polite. We ate at a couple of typically Italian resturants, very close to the hotel, which were lovely, and probably much cheaper than in the centre. All in all, we loved our stay, and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jrittenour
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a sigh of relief after a long trip. It was clean, well kept and the staff was VERY friendly. There was even an enclosed shower (the first on our trip!) which was great. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and they even had CNN (after 2 weeks it was nice to hear some English and see what was going on at home). This hotel is somewhat off the beaten path it was nice to get away from the hustle of the big city. It was very easy to walk to the tram (an above ground trolley - similar to the green line in Boston) and in 5 minutes you were into the main city. From there is was easy to walk or take the subway anywhere you wanted to go. I was definitely stay here again. On a side note - i do NOT recommend the bus tour they use (Green line). We took their Rome by Night tour and it was terrible. Half of it was before the sun even went down, the tour guide was terrible and the bus drive was so crazy I thought we were going to crash!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good hotel a short tram ride out of town.”
Reviews.Author: Steve Winter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villa Glori on May for a few days. Booked Villa Glori on the basis of tripadvisor rating and price and my expectation was exceeded. It's a well run, clean little place which is in a suburb about 10 minutes out of Rome central when you grab the tram. As it turns out, that is probably a good thing because you wind up going to the local deli, chemist etc and that gives you a little feel for how the Romans live their daily lives. The only negative was that it took some finding in my rental car because it is a bit out of the way. Would recommend in the mid range price point.

Reviews.Title: “So quiet, so small”
Reviews.Author: LanaBLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Villa Glori (in room 112) as part of an Easyjet package deal (£222 for accom and flights = very reasonable). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Villa Glori. The ladies will love the abundance of mirrors in these rooms and the lighting in the bathroom was fabulous! The view from our room was gorgeous - overlooking an ivy-strewn courtyard and beyond onto some gorgeous Roman residences complete with shutters and roof terraces. It is very private. Our room was small with barely enough room to walk around the beds (2 singles) but had a decent sized and very clean bathroom (exhaust fan not working), safe for your valuables and decent amount of hanging space. The service was polite though we wern't floored with kindness. Our TV wasn't working and it was promptly fixed (a plasma with a pay to view option) and there were no utensils or glasses for eats or drinks you might want to consume in the room (only plastic cups). Air con was great. The one thing I must emphasise is the quietness of this area - it is central but so so quiet. It's just north of Piaza Del Popolo / Flaminio metro - about a 20 min walk to both of these attractions or 10mins on the number 2 tram which is just outside the hotel. A cab from the hotel to the Pantheon or Piaza Navona should only cost 8 euro and from the Termini about 9 euro. It is very reasonable. Don't try any restaurants around the hotel they are all rather average - head to the Jewish quarter or Travestere instead. The breakfast was okay - a plain spread of boiled eggs, rolls, ham/cheese, yoghurts and croissants with coffee and red orange juice. Two things may have helped the ambience of the breakfast room which was lacking in 'vibe' somewhat - some music and the blinds being drawn. I didn't understand them not using their gorgeous courtyard areas during summer - some seating/tables out there to eat breakfast at would be a great way to start the day. This hotel could easily fill a very boutique sector and up its rating and prices to suit if they made some changes like adding a bar/cafe to rest at at the end of an exhaustuing day exploring Roma, and using their space better, because overall it has great bones and is very clean and quiet. We arranged the Terravision shuttle to and from Ciampino airport which was fine but the transit time is quite lengthy (we had to leave at 7.45am from the Termini to catch a 10.45am flight). Just something to consider. It cost 14 euro return (a cab would probably cost 50 euro or so). My friend and I would both stay here again and definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel, problem with overbooking”
Reviews.Author: Mgz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week Italian vacation where we spent 3 nights in Rome at Villa Glori. If I could, I would rate this a 3 1/2 star due to an issue at check-in, but otherwise we were satisfied. OVERBOOKING ISSUE: When we arrived on Friday midday, reservation in hand, we were told that they overbooked and would move us. I research properties before I go, and on top of this we were exhausted, so moving to another property I did not know was unacceptable. I told the desk this and, after a time, checked us in. While I was talking to the desk person, another family came down and told me that the same thing happened to them the evening before, and that he learned that around 10 parties were similarly "overbooked." In this age of computerized reservations and to-the-minute updates, I have no doubt that the overbooking was intentional, not a system issue. EVERYTHING ELSE: Other than this issue, the hotel was very good. The room was small (9x11) but typical by European standards, but impeccably clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was also impeccable, with a powerful though very small shower. Beds were generally comfortable though just a smallish double; I'd prefer a feather top or other more comfortable bed. Closet space was also a bit tight, but acceptable. The hotel is in a small alley/street in a lovely residential neighborhood, very pleasant to sit outside or walk around and quiet. Breakfasts were average European fare, good but with modest selection. Service after we checked in was good. Our room was cleaned early, and they seemed to get in there even when we were only gone an hour or so. The front desk called taxis for us and provided some other guidance; only the day staff was very fluent in English. Location was reasonably accessible from Centro Storico (downtown monuments) and other areas, but not as close as being there, of course. The tram, which we used frequently, takes about 8 minutes to get to its last stop on Flaminio, and from there the metro is about a 5 minute walk. Taxis to Centro Storico varied from 7 to 13 Euro each way, depending on traffic and time of day. There are several local dining options: three trattorias, fairly comparable, on the street opposite and a gelateria around the corner. All had good service and deep menus; we recommend them for moderate-cost, satisfying local fare or a wine break. In summary, we enjoyed this hotel, but the check in overbooking issue left a bad taste. If I return to Rome, I would likely opt for a closer property to the downtown area, but for affordability, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Villa Glori”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_2511
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Villa Glori for 3 nights in early June 07, at a cost of €330. I had a great stay at this hotel - the room was compact, but with only a single bed there was lots of room to move around. Had a built in wardrobe (with safe), a dresser, tv and minibar. Bathroom was a good size (with a fantastic shower!), and all was spotlessly clean. Breakfast was continental, not extensive but enough. Staff on reception were extremely helpful with every request, and even offered me a toothbrush as I had forgotten mine! It's a bit further out of Rome than I had imagined, but it's easy to get the tram from the end of the street, down Via Flaminia to Piazza del Popolo - tickets are from a newspaper kiosk down the road a bit, and €1 will take you on the tram, bus, metro and train within Rome for the next 75 minutes. Then through the arch and across Piazza del Popolo to either walk or get one of the little buses from the end of Via del Corso to Piazza Venezia. From there it's easy to get to all the sights, and the Metro from Piazza del Popolo will take you to Vatican City too. If you get chance, have a walk around the park surrounding the Villa Borghese, it's a good place to relax for a while after a long day! There are a few nice restaurants in the streets surrounding the hotel which aren't too expensive and where you can just sit and relax after your meal without being hurried out. All in all, a good base from which to explore Rome whilst having a less hectic feel than some of the more central hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: bpclave99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, rooms are small but nice, shower is small. The staff was great! The only thing we didn't like is that it was far from the main plaza where everything is.....Piazza Pipolo aka Flaminio. I would try to get a little closer to there next time especially for someone who is disabled. You can take tram no. 2 right to Flaminio in 5 minutes 2 blocks away BUT be sure to be back to your hotel early because the last tram is around 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lovely, but location bit too far out”
Reviews.Author: nch
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It is a lovely hotel, clean and good value. We stayed in Room 202 which was a fair size with a shower room en suite. The service was very good, very clean, decent continental breakfast, staff very helpful. We found the location a bit far out of central Rome but this did not spoil our stay. The No 2 tram is at the bottom of the road which takes you to Flaminio where you can get the Metro to the centre, all for 1 euro (75 mins allowed on all public transport for this). Remember to validate ticket on tram/Metro as you could be fined if you don't. On the plus side because we weren't central, the restaurants near Villa Glori were much cheaper and food excellent. The grocery over the road was good value too for lovely fresh fruit.. The clientele at this hotel when we stayed was predominantly Italian business men so they obviously understand good value. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because of the shower en suite and would have preferred a bath as well but there was no availability to change rooms. I would recommend this hotel for good value and if you can cope with getting trams and the Metro to get to city centre. Not suitable for disabled travellers due to steps out side and very small lift.

Reviews.Title: “Tops for location, accommodations, value and great service”
Reviews.Author: allen94022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Villa Glori for six days in April 2007. It is in a great location – on a non-traffic cul de sac in a quiet and peaceful area with an alimentari (deli/grocery), a fruit stand, a gelateria, and a cafe/bar all across the access street, making for a pleasant neighborhood. There is a good restaurant also across the street from Villa Glori (Pizzeria/Trattoria Vignola) and a better one (La Romanina) about three blocks walk. The frequent No. 2 tram is a hundred yards away and a 7 minute quick ride to Piazza del Popolo. One euro is good for 75 minutes on public transportation - tram, bus, metro - so the cost to get about anywhere is small. It was nice to return after a day of busy sightseeing to our pleasant local neighborhood of shops and friendly Italians - away from all the tourists. The hotel is quite nice. Good breakfast in the morning, very clean, and well appointed rooms (don’t worry about the small elevator). Our room for one night on our arrival to Italy was fine and then when we returned to Rome we had Room 106 for five nights, which was really quite lovely with a very nice bathroom and shower. The staff was friendly and helpful. We very much enjoyed Leo’s engaging personality at the front desk. Leo speaks PERFECT English (he lived in the US as a teenager), helped us repeatedly with our questions about Rome and local restaurants, and is most entertaining. Alfredo was also very hospitable and helpful. Hotel Villa Glori offers excellent value, good rooms, friendly and accommodative staff, and an excellent location away from the tourist meccas, but within easy reach. We enjoyed our stay and recommend Hotel Villa Glori.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: ronski2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in villa glori for 3 nights. Rome is the last stop in our trip. It was easy to get to the hotel. If you're coming from the termini station take the metro and get off at the flaminio stop then take the tram #2 (im not sure of the name of the stop). Then from there you just walk across the street you'll find the hotel. The room is small but very nice and clean. Breakfast is okay. Staff is friendly. As mentioned by others the lift is reallllyy small. We used the stairs a lot since we're just in the 2nd fl. We would stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kazprincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2days whilst visit Rome and loved it!! It was so easy to find - literally across the street from the Tram stop number 2. When you get off the tram, cross over the street and its down the first or second turning on the left? You wont miss it! The hotel was lovely -everything i could possible want. It wasnt a luxury massive penthouse or anything, but clean, modern, reasonable sized and perfect for a few days and brilliant for the low cost price! We booked through easy jet hotels and the total for a two night stay for two people was £114 including a contential breakfast. The breakfast was ok, pretty standard it seemed for Italy. Selection of bread, cheese, cereal, yougart ect. We stayed in florence for 2 nights and the breakfast here was pretty much the same. The room was nicely sized and the bathroom was massive! We had such a nice big shower and it was clean and look new. They have an electronic safe as well which is handy for passports, money, keys ect. I would defintely return here. The hotel was perfect and so cheap! You would expect a hotel like this to be charging more!! Beware of the lift by the way - its safe but its the smallest lift i have ever seen in my life!! hahah Dont have any worries about staying here! We stayed in a 4* in Florence and it wasnt half as nice as the Vilia Glori.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbshaw2000
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a good location. Very clean rooms and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!Will come back!”
Reviews.Author: posina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly recommended. I stayed with a friend for three nights. The hotel was very clean and very stylish. The pictures shown at [----] are outdated, so it was a great surprise to see the actual hotel. The rooms are comfortable and the shower room is superb!!. The tram 2 pass by very often so it is very convenient to get to the town centre! My only complains are probably the breakfast, in line with Italian standards (the worst the orange juice!) but they made proper coffee for us on request and that we couldn't find an internet point in reception. I will definitely stay here on my next visit to Rome. Susana (Amsterdam)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Get to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ROLLERS
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here months in advance only to find that when we arrived we were met at reception by a man who told us "we have big problem" and we were escorted outside to a taxi which he paid for and told us we were going to their sister Hotel Fleming which was 4* and 5 mins away. Both of which were lies. The Hotel Fleming is 30 mins bus ride away from the centre of Rome and definately not 4* I have just read comments from another person saying th same thing happened to them and they were transferred away too so I definately recommend that you do not book either of these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mel777dublin
Reviews.Content: On arrival at this hotel we were told the toilet in our room was broken and we had to move to there sister hotel hotel Fleming which was awful, however when we were moved back the next day Villa Glori really made up for it , hotel was pristine and decorated really nice the bedroom was spacious, bathroom was great and we could turn heating on and off as we wished. When we booked we thought it was abit far out but this was not the case we used the tram to take us to Piazza del Poppolo and then walked everywhere from there it was so easy finding our way around and the tram only took about 7mins and it ran up till 12 at night. The few restaurants near the hotel were good also. We ate out near Piazza Navona most nights. I would definitely book the hotel again its in expensive and of a high quality with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: dickslass
Reviews.Content: stayed at "the villa glori" 17th - 20th january. We found the staff very helpful and they all spoke very good english, nothing was too much trouble to them. The room we stayed in no.308 had two balconies and was vary large and bright, spotlessly clean and we got clean towels every day. The no.2 tram stop is a stone throw away, this takes you to piazzia poppolo where you can walk to all the sights of this wonderful city. It costs 1 euro. We walked to the olympic stadium from the hotel, took about 20mins. We took the no.2 tram to poppolo then walked over the river to the vatican this was a lovely stroll along the river taking about 45mins, we passed alot of beautiful buildings that we would not have seen if we hadn't walked. This hotel is ideally situated, far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city, but still easily accessable. We booked a transfer from the airport with terravision this was an ideal way of getting into the city, but beware when you get off taxis appear out of nowhere, some are not proper taxis, we know it cost us 27euros instead of 10, always use a proper metered taxi

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ajcat61
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good with enough selection to get you through to lunch. The location was good, a three minute tram ride down to Piazza Del Popolo where you could find a bus to anywhere. A very good pizzeria across the street, Pizzeria Vignola. I was very worried reading some of the reviews, but don't be. This was a great place to stay in Rome and would highly recommend. I would also like to recommend the Roma Pass, for around 20 euros you get into two museums or historical sights and a three day unlimited public transport pass. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too far away”
Reviews.Author: pnkyswr
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I liked this hotel but think we could have stayed at a similar hotel in a much more convenient location. In a city as big as Rome, we think you need a very centrally located hotel to avoid getting overtired or overwhelmed. To get to some locations, we had to take a tram (or walk 15-20 minutes to the metro) and then take two metros to get there. If you book a room here, be willing to walk a lot. We are both walkers, but Rome was the last stop on our trip, and we were a bit more tired than when we first started off. The accomodations were nice, but we also stayed in comparable hotels in other cities that were much more centrally located and paid about the same. The service was good though not extraordinary. The breakfast was decent though the breakfasts we had in other hotels in Italy were much better.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem In Rome”
Reviews.Author: topcatclifton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a delightful 5 day stay in Rome. The Hotel Villa Glori faces onto a very pretty mews and is an elegant, quiet, comfortable small hotel. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the buffet breakfast is very acceptable. It is a 5 minute walk to the tram stop. The trams are frequent and the journey only about 10 minutes to the Piazza del Popolo. I would definately stay at the hotel again and can recommend it without any hesitation to other visitors. Mrs D Calmeyer

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Aida1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel becaus of all the good revews and they were all true. This is a wonderfull hotel in a nice part of Rome. The rooms are clean and the bathrooms are spaceos. Breakfast buffe is great, a lot of things too chose from and helpfull staff. The easyest way to get there is to take the Metro to Flaminio/plazza del popolo and then take Tram nr 2. I would recommend this hotel too everybody

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accomodation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: safarijones
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel - a lot more hotel-like than we were expecting. It seemed very new, the rooms were smart and clean although compact (as usual in Europe). The location in my opinion was excellent down a little mews street and extremely quiet. A good 15-20 minute walk to the nearest metro but the tram is there if you prefer. On the last night we ate at the pizzeria across the road and it was full of locals - you really got a sense that you were out of the tourist areas and in the "real" Rome. Getting around on the metro is easy and a taxi to the Trastevere area for dinner was 10-15 Euros 1 way, so it was not an issue for us that you couldn't walk to the major attractions. A great stay for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelMama
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with the Villa Glori, our room was much smarter than the photos show. There were plenty of large mirrors, a large fully tiled shower room, good sized roomsafe and minibar. The hairdryer isn't fantastic though so bring your own if you're very fussy! The only downside to the location of the room on the ground floor was the proximity to the breakfast room directly opposite. We were woken early with the scraping of chairs on the tiled floor either the early guests or staff preparing for breakfast, I'm not sure which. This served as an alarm call! The breakfast had a good selection of croissants/rolls etc plus cereals,yogurts and the usual continental cheeses and meats. The reception staff were very helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay. The no 2 tram stop is very close to the hotel and it's only a 20 minute walk to Paizza del Poppolo, which was fine during the day although we used taxis in the evening which cost 5 or 6 euros from near Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: LittleOl
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for only a few days and this hotel proved to be ideal. It is only a short and cheap tram ride towards the centre of Rome yet far enough away to be out of the tourist trap. The hotel was spotless and the reception staff were all fluent in English and very helpful. The reception desk is manned 24-7 so there is no trouble getting your key. Breakfast was basic but adequate and don't really have any major complains. The room was spotless and it was great having an LCD TV with sky with channels I could put into English! The room was quite a good size and very comfortable. The only thing that I could complain about was that the air conditioning was not that good and the room was quite warm - not good in Rome in August. Would easily stay there again. There are two restaurants on the same road as the hotel and I wouldn't bother with either of them. The one at the bottom of the street spoke no English and even though my Italian is very limited I am sure that it was her fault that we didn't get what we wanted. We were also charged for drinks that we didn't order. We just paid up and left without leaving a tip. If you do onto the street running parallel to the hotel (nearer the centre of Rome) there is another restaurant about half way up. Again the staff didn't speak English but this made no difference. The staff were helpful and friendly and the food was fantastic. We wanted to go back on our last night but unfortunately it was closed. The best meal we had in two weeks. A good place to stay and if I return to Rome I would probably return there.
